SEARCH
Package midtermlabproject3

Class HuffmanEncoder

java.lang.Object
midtermlabproject3.HuffmanEncoder
public class HuffmanEncoder extends Object
This class provides methods for encoding and decoding text using the Huffman encoding algorithm. It includes functionality for building frequency tables, generating Huffman codes, and calculating encoding efficiency.

  • Method Details

    • buildFrequencyTable

      public Map<Character,Integer> buildFrequencyTable(String text)
      Method to build the table with frequencies from the given text.
      Parameters:
      text - the input string to analyze
      Returns:
      a map containing characters as keys and their frequencies as values

    • buildCustomFrequencyTable

      public Map<Character,Integer> buildCustomFrequencyTable()
      Builds a custom frequency table by prompting the user for character frequencies.
      Returns:
      a map containing characters as keys and their manually inputted frequencies as values

    • buildHuffmanTree

      public Node buildHuffmanTree(Map<Character,Integer> frequencyTable)
      Method to build the Huffman Tree using the frequency table.
      Parameters:
      frequencyTable - map of characters and their respective frequencies
      Returns:
      the root node of the Huffman tree

    • buildHuffmanCode

      public void buildHuffmanCode(Node node, String code, Map<Character,String> huffmanCode)
      Method that traverses the Huffman Tree to make the binary code for each character (Makes use of pre-order traversal).
      Parameters:
      node - the current node in the Huffman tree
      code - the current Huffman code being generated
      huffmanCode - map to store the generated Huffman codes for each character

    • calculateEfficiency

      public String calculateEfficiency(String text, Map<Character,String> huffmanCode, int encodingBits)
      Method that calculates the efficiency of the Huffman Code compared to the original size.
      Parameters:
      text - the input text to analyze
      encodingBits - the number of bits used for fixed-length encoding (e.g., 7 for ASCII, 8 for EBCDIC)
      Returns:
      a string representing the efficiency percentage

    • encode

      public String encode(String text, Map<Character,String> huffmanCode) throws InvalidEncodedTextException
      Method to encode a given text using the generated Huffman Code.
      Parameters:
      text - the input text to encode
      Returns:
      the Huffman-encoded string
      Throws:
      InvalidEncodedTextException - if the text contains invalid characters not found in the Huffman code

    • decode

      public String decode(String text, Node root) throws InvalidEncodedTextException
      Method to decode a given text using the generated Huffman Code.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be decoded
      root - the root node used to base the current node
      Returns:
      string representing the decoded text
      Throws:
      InvalidEncodedTextException - if the encoded text is invalid
